Cyclonus stood near a computer console and view screen looking over
scans of Earth, and the current energy signatures. -No- the Earth was
still not ready for assimilation by Unicron. Cyclonus was not sure if
it would be any time soon before it would.

Behind Cyclonus the door opened and Scourge stepped in and looked
around. "Any news yet?" His voice grumpy as he glanced at the view
screen Cyclonus was looking at.

"No Scourge." Cyclonus' voice was calm and low, and it was obvious from
his tone that this was a common exchange between them. Cyclonus
patiently waiting for any communication from the Earth, and Scourge
impatiently asking if there was any word. "I am sure it will be soon."

As if on cue the console beeped to announce incomming data. Cyclonus
looked down at it as he checked the authenication codes and accepted
the feed. 

For a long moment Cyclonus read as Scourge read over his shoulder.
Words scrolled past them at dizzying speed. When it finally came to a
stop Scourge sat down in a nearby chair and shook his head a small
smile on his face. 

Cyclonus on the other hand stored the data on his own personal chip as
well as the base computers. He looked at Scourge, "Have the soldiers on
Earth keep an optic fastened to the Maximals at Atlantis. Let us know
when they are to depart." 

Cyclonus stood and smiled as he reached over and tapped a few keys on
the computer, "We on the other hand have other things to accomplish." 

On the wall the small viewscreen showed the coordinates of the Black
Fortress - it blinks once and then turned solid. 

Cyclonus turned to Scourge, "Come, we have much to accomplish. Prepare
the sweeps."

Scourge nodded almost eagerly as he followed Cyclonus through the doors
exiting the chamber, already chattering orders on his radio.

Preston
(Da'minion)
